intro: Nemophila divaricata, commonly known as the Sierra starflower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It features small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and meadow habitats. Nemophila divaricata is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
